> <OLD>
>
> WHEELIE did not react over to the parroting of his own mannerisms, merely
> explaining, "Where I come from, this is what saved my bum.  It was a way, to
> keep my processor off what hapepend each day.  And into each night, it would
> serve to give the others a fright.  It is what kept me strong, where I was
> when I didn't belong."
>
> As the trio walked towards where UNUS was, WHEELIE tensed up again, but
> surreptisiously in the sense of any old veteran warrior scanning the area
> for a quick escape route if it was needed.  "So, tell me about this UNUS.
> What has he or she done to give you such presence?"
>
> WHEELIE glancing up at ASTRA and FIREHORN, "So tell me, how you came to be?
> This world is strange, it is not quite home on the range."  Walking along to
> the door as he went silent upon noticing thier regalness, waiting for them
> to say he could enter.

<NEW>

There was a nod from FIREHORN as he entered inside the door, the
guards stepping back to let him pass. There was somehting ceremonial
and even crisp in the movements.

ASTRA, noticing WHEELIE's hesitation, "Unus will answer that
question." she said as she gestured for him to come, her movments also
becoming a litle straighter and taller.

On the otherside of the door was a large chamber with other figures
moving about, all of them looking much like ASTRA and FIREHORN. They
were not quite clones, but they were variations on the same theme.
Similar colors, size and presumably abilities although there were
slight differences for those who were observant enough to catch them.

The room itself was semiornate with precious gems of different sorts
lining the walls, strange and exotic metals taking up the rest of it.
Pictures had been painted and placed in various places, and even
ornate flowers were allowed to grow around the room, the flowers
carefully placed to give the room an exotic look.

The intrior of the room was quite large with pillars placed
strategiaclly around the room, providing support for the stone ceiling
of the room. There were no widows visible in the chamber although
there were doors leading to other parts of the structure.

In the center of the room was a figure who looked much like ASTRA and
FIREHORN as well as the others in the room but he looked to be a
little larger and massive as he sat on the throne that was positioned
in the cetner of the room as well. He seemed to be listening to the
report of several figures before him.

"That is Unus." ASTRA said quietly as she directed her gaze to the
figure on the throne.

(OOC: Assuming Wheelie enters the room)

UNUS looked away from those who were talking to him as he spotted
WHEELIE and gestured for him to come foward. "Come come." he said
encouragingly. The few other individuals who were milling about the
room stepping back so that Wheelie could venture foward to the throne
if he chose. They all turned to look at him as if appraising him, as
if they had not seen the one of his build and construction.

(TAG)

Preston
